website_summaries.verdict: Overall, the Merrell Bare Access XTR is accepted by the majority of the users to be a fantastic pair of shoes. The footwear is loved by many because of its traction and impeccable ground connection that makes it easy to run on trails. Although others have issues with its width, durability, and toe box, others still lauded its minimalistic design. Without sacrificing the cushioning requirement, the shoe provides the foot with comfort and protection during the activity. Its breathable upper mesh was also loved by many buyers. It offers excellent ventilation that is beneficial to the foot during the running session.
pros: Some users applaud the Merrell Bare Access XTR’s lightweight structure
The majority of the buyers have positive reactions to the traction it offers
One of the most popular comments from consumers is the comfort that Merrell Bare Access XTR provides
A lot of consumers appreciate its flexibility when it comes to interchanging usage from walking, running on pavements and complex trails
Some runners gave good reviews about its minimalistic design while still having sufficient cushion
Many users compliment the great ground connection they feel when they run using Merrell Bare Access XTR
cons: A good number of runners criticize the level of durability of the upper mesh
One user commented that the shoe felt somewhat tight in the width and toe box
A couple of wearers have observed the rubber of the outsole to wear out quickly

customer_reviews.title: Merrell wins again
customer_reviews.text: I have very few shoes that are not Merrell. Not only are Merrell very comfortable, but they are also very suited to my lifestyle which involves walking my dog in parks, woods and beaches both on and off tracks and pathways. I walk a couple of hours on most days and these shoes last long enough to make it a worth while investment.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: good starter
customer_reviews.text: ...towards barefoot / no drop shoes. Relatively comfortable and doing the job well enough. Sole is (I think) 17mm so markedly thinner than the heel of most trainers but not the 3mm of barefoot shoes 'proper.' Might be a tiny bit uncomfortable to start with,especially if you are new to no-drop shoes (introduce yourself to them slowly) - but I think that is pretty normal. Looks quite nice if you don't mind a little splash of colour!
customer_reviews.author: N D S

customer_reviews.title: Very light, very comfortable. Foot well supported.
customer_reviews.text: I was after a pair of breathable, lightweight trainers for summer, and these fit the bill perfectly. Fit is perfect, lots of support in sole and arch, and coped with 38C in Greece without sweaty feet :)
customer_reviews.author: etchacan

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very light, comfortable and cool for a sports shoe. They are not waterproof but I knew that. Overall everything I expected, I’m personally very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B

customer_reviews.title: I totally love these sneakers
customer_reviews.text: I totally love these sneakers - perfect balance between the more barefoot merrells - they have more arch support and more rugged soles but still feel v light - and the more cushioned ones.

customer_reviews.title: Great for road and trail running
customer_reviews.text: Already ran 37km in these shoes and I am loving them so far. Fit so nicely and comfortable to use on both roads and trails. Such good value given the price. Would suggest going on a lighter run or walk in them first to break them in.

customer_reviews.title: Barefoot Shoe with Cushion & Structure
customer_reviews.text: If like me you like the barefoot shoe feel, with plenty of toe space, a low connection with the ground and light low profile runner; THIS is the shoe for you. I'm a massive fan of the Merrell brand, and I own a pair of Vapor Glove 4's. For me (as I'm not as biomechanically gifted as some of the barefoot fans out there), I quickly discovered that I benefit more from a touch more cushion and structure to my shoe. The Bare Access XTR has this; but maintains the barefoot feel. What you sacrifice in ground feel and flexibility, you gain in structure and comfort for longer miles. Great shoes. Thanks Merrell.
customer_reviews.author: Carly Beatz

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable trainers I have ever worn, I still cannot get over how comfortable they are. Excellent for walking and hiking however not so great for the treadmill if you need some padding. If they last a year or so I'll buy again.

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Bare Access XTR Trail Running Shoes
product_meta.description: This trail runner features 0mm heel to toe offset, a moderate amount of shock absorbing foam and a sticky vibram outsole which enhances ground Connection. Offers a true Connection to the ground for fast and agile runs on light to moderate trails.
